tit.j: アンドロニク・ニコリスキイ
tit.cmt: 名字を大文字にしました。

sen.j: アンドロニク・ニコリスキイ（、Andronic Nikolsky、1870年8月1日 - 1918年7月7日 (ユリウス暦で6月20日））は、ロシア正教会と日本正教会の主教。
sen.e: Andronic Nikolsky (August 1, 1870 - July 7, 1918) (Julian calendar: June 20) was a bishop of the Russian Orthodox Church and the Japanese Orthodox Church.
Andronic Nikolsky (August 1, 1870 - July 7, 1918) (Julian calendar: June 20) was a bishop of the Russian Orthodox Church and the Japanese Orthodox Church.
Andronic NIKOLSKY (August 1, 1870 - July 7 (or June 20 under the Julian calendar), 1918) was a bishop of the Russian Orthodox Church and the Japanese Orthodox Church.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 聖人。
sen.e: A saint
A saint
He was raised to sainthood.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 日本正教会では初代京都の主教でもあった事から、「ペルミの神品致命者聖アンドロニク」の称号のほかに「初代京都の主教聖アンドロニク」の名でも呼ばれる。
sen.e: As he was assigned as the first bishop of Kyoto in the Japanese Orthodox Church, he was also called "the first bishop of Kyoto" with the title of "Hieromartyr Andronik, Archbishop of Perm."
sen.cmt: 本名はAndronicですが、タイトルになると、Andronik とスペルされる方が多いようです
sen.e: As he was assigned as the first bishop of Kyoto in the Japanese Orthodox Church, he was also called "the first bishop of Kyoto" with the title of "Hieromartyr Andronik, Archbishop of Perm."
As he was assigned as the first bishop of Kyoto in the Japanese Orthodox Church, he was also called 'the first bishop of Kyoto' with the title of 'Hieromartyr Andronik, Archbishop of Perm.'

sen.j: ロシア革命時に、生き埋めの上で銃殺され殉教した事で知られる。
sen.e: He was known to be martyred in the Russian Revolution; he was buried alive and shot dead.
He was known to be martyred in the Russian Revolution; he was buried alive and shot dead.
He is famous for having been martyred during the Russian Revolution: first he was buried alive, and then he was shot to death.

sen.j: 1870年8月1日、ヤロスラヴリ教区のムィシュキン村（enMyshkin）に生まれる（俗名：ウラジーミル・ニコリスキイ）。
sen.e: He was born on August 1, 1870, in Myshkin village, Yaroslavl diocese (secular name: Vladimir Nikolsky).
He was born on August 1, 1870, in Myshkin village, Yaroslavl diocese (secular name: Vladimir Nikolsky).
He was born on August 1, 1870, in Myshkin village, part of Yaroslavl diocese (his secular name was Vladimir NIKOLSKY).

sen.j: 父は輔祭。
sen.e: His father was a deacon.
His father was a deacon.
His father was a deacon.

sen.j: 1891年にヤロスラヴリ神学校を卒業すると、モスクワ神学大学に入学。
sen.e: After graduating from the Yaroslavl Seminary in 1891, he entered the Moscow Theological Academy.
After graduating from the Yaroslavl Seminary in 1891, he entered the Moscow Theological Academy.
In 1891 he graduated from Yaroslavl Seminary and then entered Moscow Theological Academy.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 在学中の1893年8月1日に修道士となり、アンドロニクの修道名を授かる。
sen.e: While in school, he became a monk on August 1, 1893, and was given the religious name of Andronik.
While in school, he became a monk on August 1, 1893, and was given the religious name of Andronik.
He became a monk on August 1, 1893 while still at school, receiving the Christian name "Andronic."

sen.j: 1895年7月22日、修道司祭に叙聖された。
sen.e: On July 22, 1895, he was ordained as a priest.
On July 22, 1895, he was ordained as a priest.
On July 22, 1895, he was ordained as a priest.

sen.j: その後、クタイシの神学校に赴任する。
sen.e: Then, he took his post at a theological seminary in Kutaisi.
Then, he took his post at a theological seminary in Kutaisi.
Thereafter, he was assigned to the Kutaisi Theological Seminary.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1898年には1年弱の期間、来日して日本正教会での修道司祭の任にあった。
sen.e: For less than a year in 1898, he stayed in Japan to assume the task as a priest in the Japanese Orthodox Church.
For less than a year in 1898, he stayed in Japan to assume the task as a priest in the Japanese Orthodox Church.
In 1898, he was sent to Japan as a priest in the Japanese Orthodox Church, staying there for less than a year.

sen.j: 1900年には掌院に昇叙された。
sen.e: In 1900, he was promoted to Archimandrite.

sen.j: 京都の主教として
sen.e: As a bishop of Kyoto

sen.j: 1906年11月、ロシア正教会の聖務会院によってニコライ・カサートキンを輔佐する主教として、来日経験のあるアンドロニクを選ぶ決定がなされた事により、掌院アンドロニクは京t都の主教に叙聖された。
sen.e: In November 1906, the Most Holy Governing Synod of the Russian Orthodox Church appointed Andronic who had experienced living in Japan as a bishop to assist Nikolai Kasatkin; Archimandrite Andronik was ordained as a bishop of Kyoto.

In November 1906, the Most Holy Governing Synod of the Russian Orthodox Church appointed Andronic, who had experienced living in Japan, as a bishop to assist Nikolai Kasatkin; Archimandrite Andronik was ordained as the bishop of Kyoto.

In November of 1906, the Most Holy Governing Synod of the Russian Orthodox Church appointed Andronic--who had experience living in Japan--a bishop and sent him to assist Nikolai KASATKIN; Archimandrite Andronic was then ordained as the bishop of Kyoto.

sen.j: 叙聖式はアレクサンドル・ネフスキー大修道院の大聖堂で行われた。
sen.e: The ordination was held at the cathedral of the Alexander Nevsky Lavra.
The ordination was held at the cathedral of the Alexander Nevsky Lavra.
The ordination was held at the cathedral of the Alexander Nevsky Lavra.

sen.j: 1907年3月8日、京都正教会の司祭シメオン三井道郎が出迎える敦賀港に入港。
sen.e: On March 8, 1907, he arrived at the port of Tsuruga where Priest Simeon Michiro Mitsui of the Kyoto Orthodox Church welcomed him.
On March 8, 1907, he arrived at the port of Tsuruga where Priest Simeon Michiro Mitsui of the Kyoto Orthodox Church welcomed him.
On March 8, 1907, he arrived at the port of Tsuruga, where the priest Simeon Michiro MITSUI of the Kyoto Orthodox Church was waiting to welcome him.

sen.j: 1907年4月7日の生神女福音祭は京都正教会（生神女福音聖堂）で司祷している。
sen.e: He performed the annunciation on April 7, 1907, at the Kyoto Orthodox Church (Kyoto Annunciation Cathedral).
He performed the annunciation on April 7, 1907, at the Kyoto Orthodox Church (Kyoto Annunciation Cathedral).
He performed the annunciation on April 7, 1907, at the Kyoto Orthodox Church (Kyoto Annunciation Cathedral).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 同年4月下旬には「京都の主教」のタイトルではあるが大阪を常任地とする決定を東京滞在中に行った（常任地をタイトルと違う場所に設定する事は正教会ではあまり珍しく無い）。
sen.e: In spite of his title as "Bishop of Kyoto," Osaka was disignated as his place of work at the end of April the same year while he was staying in Tokyo. (It is not uncommon that the Eastern Orthodox Church designates a place of work which does not coincide with the place of appointment.)

In spite of his title as "Bishop of Kyoto," Osaka was disignated as his place of work at the end of April the same year while he was staying in Tokyo. (It is not uncommon for the Eastern Orthodox Church to designate a place of work which does not coincide with the place of appointment.)

In late April of 1907, while staying in Tokyo, he was assigned to the city of Osaka, and this despite his title "Bishop of Kyoto." (It is not uncommon for the Eastern Orthodox Church to assign priests to areas that are at variance with their titles.)

sen.j: 聖枝祭、受難週、復活大祭、光明週間、フォマの主日を大阪正教会で司祷している。
sen.e: He performed Palm Sunday, Holy Week, Easter, Bright Week, and Saint Thomas Sunday at the Osaka Orthodox Church.
He performed Palm Sunday, Holy Week, Easter, Bright Week, and Saint Thomas Sunday at the Osaka Orthodox Church.
He performed Palm Sunday, Holy Week, Easter, Bright Week, and Saint Thomas Sunday at the Osaka Orthodox Church.

sen.j: しかしながら体調の悪化により滞在僅か3ヶ月で6月中旬にロシアに帰国した。
sen.e: However, he went back to Russia at the end of June after a stay of just three months because of his bad health condition.
However, he went back to Russia at the end of June after a stay of just three months because of his bad health.
But his health soon declined, so he went back to Russia at the end of June after a stay of just three months.

sen.j: ロシア革命により致命
sen.e: Martyrdom in the Russian Revolution
Martyrdom in the Russian Revolution
Martyrdom in the Russian Revolution

sen.j: 帰国後10年間、1898年に共に来日した経験のあるセルギイ・ストラゴロツキイと共にロシア正教会の中枢で活躍した。
sen.e: For ten years after returning to Russia, he took a leading role in the Russian Orthodox Church with Sergius Stragorodsky with whom he visited Japan in 1898.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: For ten years after returning to Russia, he took a leading role in the Russian Orthodox Church with Sergius Stragorodsky with whom he visited Japan in 1898.

For ten years after returning to Russia, Andronic had a leadership role in the Russian Orthodox Church, along with Sergius STRAGORODSKY, who was also part of the 1898 mission to Japan that Andronic had joined.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、ロシア革命によって無神論を掲げ宗教弾圧を行うボリシェヴィキが政権を握るとロシア正教会は大弾圧を蒙った。
sen.e: However, when the Bolshevik, which advocated atheism and instituted a religious persecution, took power following the Russian Revolution, the Russian Orthodox Church suffered great oppression.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, when the Bolsheviks, which advocated atheism and instituted religious persecution, took power following the Russian Revolution, the Russian Orthodox Church suffered great oppression.

But the Russian Orthodox Church suffered terrible oppression once the Bolsheviks--who advocated atheism and instituted a campaign of religious persecution--came to power following the Russian Revolution.

sen.j: 大主教アンドロニク（1918年4月にアンドロニクは大主教に昇叙されていた）は1918年6月22日、ボリシェヴィキの秘密警察によりペルミの森で自ら掘らされた墓穴に生き埋めにされた上で銃殺され致命した。
sen.e: Archbishop Andronik (he was promoted to Archbishop in April 1918) was martyred; he was buried alive in a grave pit he dug for himself in Perm woods and shot dead by the Bolshevik secret police.
Archbishop Andronik (he was promoted to Archbishop in April 1918) was martyred; he was buried alive in a grave pit he dug for himself in Perm woods and shot dead by the Bolshevik secret police.

Archbishop Andronic (he had been promoted to Archbishop in April 1918) was martyred on June 22, 1918; first he was buried alive in a grave in the Perm Forest which he had been forced to dig himself, and then was shot to death by the Bolshevik secret police.

sen.e: The Russian Orthodox Church canonized Andronic as a New Martyr in August 2000.

sen.j: 列聖式には日本正教会から、首座主教である全日本の府主教主代郁夫と、東日本の主教セラフィム辻永昇が陪祷した。
